intro: Xiphostylis erectus, commonly known as the upright grassvetch, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its erect growth habit and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically thrives in dry, disturbed soils and is often found in grasslands and open woodlands. Its botanical features include trifoliate leaves and pods that contain several seeds, contributing to its role in soil stabilization and ecological diversity.
